What a way to finish the year!! ğŸ‰

Had a lot of fun guest lecturing inÂ Prof. Mohammad Reza Mousaviâ€™s Testing Module. Super exciting to present my work in depth and tease someÂ very fresh resultsÂ that will be published soon ğŸ‘€!

Big thanks for the trust and guidance of my supervisors, and massive respect to theÂ 3rd-year Bachelor and Master studentsÂ for being there at theÂ veryÂ end of the semester, in full exam-stress mode. I know the feeling â€”Â I was sitting exactly where you are a couple of years agoÂ ğŸ˜…

If nothing else, I hope I at leastÂ kept you awake with some quality memesÂ â˜•ğŸ“ˆ

ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· First academic event in France since I left 11 years ago â€” and what a return! TheÂ Advanced Quantum Algorithms for Many-Body SystemsÂ workshop in Montpellier was fantastic. ğŸ§  Super sharp, state-of-the-art talks on quantum algorithms for many-body physics and chemistry. ğŸŒ¿ Breaks in the botanical garden + real French cheese and natural wineâ€¦ perfect setup for good science. ğŸ¤ Great to catch up with the SEEQA crew, meet new people, and share my poster on Quantum Testability â€” paper coming soon! Huge thanks to the organisers for such a great event. Feeling inspired to connect more with the quantum community in France!Great meeting you guys ! Aleksei Ivanov, Andreas Juul Bay-Smidt, Fedor Å imkovic, Pietro MartinelloHope to meet you soon again Avner Bensoussan !
